item.title: Diving into Rust
item.description: Everything we have done so far was just setting the stage for our real goal, which is getting our hands dirty with the Rust programming language. It’s a modern engineering marvel destined to make all other languages obsolete. Either we jump on the Rust wagon now or get left behind with the memory-unsafe losers.

item.title: Connecting the Dots
item.description:
We now have a working system with several tools installed but in most cases we want these tools to work together and reach a specific state before we can start using them. Once we define what that state should look like we also need a simple way to create and tear down environments as needed.

For my use case, that state includes a Kubernetes cluster running Traefik, Prometheus and Argo CD. I automate the environment creation process with a Bash script and Terraform.

item.title: Laying the Foundation
item.description:
Since I started working with computers I always loved the idea of a homelab, a safe space to mess with stuff, break stuff and sometimes learn a few things along the way.

Back when I was trying to land my first tech job my homelab was a bunch of noisy Cisco switches and routers. Along the way I discovered GNS3 and eventually those physical switches and routers were virtualized on my Sony Vaio VGN-N31Z with it’s Core 2 Duo, 2GB of RAM and 120GB of spinning rust.

# server

# server firewall

server

apt install -y wireguard
cd /etc/wireguard
wg genkey | tee privatekey | wg pubkey > publickey
touch wg0.conf
chmod -R 600 /etc/wireguard/*

WG_SUBNET="172.16.32.0/24"
SERVER_PORT="65001"
SERVER_WG_IP="172.16.32.1"
SERVER_PRIVATE_KEY=$(cat /etc/wireguard/privatekey)

SERVER_INTERFACE=""  # ens3
SERVER_PUBLIC_IP=""  # 73.173.101.129
CLIENT_WG_IP=""      # 172.16.32.2
CLIENT_PUBLIC_KEY="" # YRrQ69zJk8jpez9X9DqFzq0i+4KGKCds3zdC5kJv4HM=

cat << EOF > /etc/wireguard/wg0.conf
[Interface]
Address = ${SERVER_WG_IP}
ListenPort = ${SERVER_PORT}
PrivateKey = ${SERVER_PRIVATE_KEY}
PostUp = echo 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward; iptables -A FORWARD -i wg0 -j ACCEPT; iptables -t nat -A POSTROUTING -o ${SERVER_INTERFACE} -j MASQUERADE
PostDown = echo 0 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward; iptables -D FORWARD -i wg0 -j ACCEPT; iptables -t nat -D POSTROUTING -o ${SERVER_INTERFACE} -j MASQUERADE

[Peer]
PublicKey = ${CLIENT_PUBLIC_KEY}
AllowedIPs = ${CLIENT_WG_IP}
PersistentKeepalive = 10
EOF

ufw allow from any to ${SERVER_PUBLIC_IP} port ${SERVER_PORT} proto udp
ufw allow from ${WG_SUBNET} to ${SERVER_WG_IP} port 22 proto tcp
ufw reload
ufw status verbose

systemctl enable wg-quick@wg0.service
history -c && history -w
